speaker: GOWER
text_entry: near the altar, as high priestess; a number of

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Virgins on each side; CERIMON and other Inhabitants

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: of Ephesus attending.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Enter PERICLES, with his train; LYSIMACHUS, HELICANUS, MARINA, and a Lady

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Hail, Dian! to perform thy just command,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I here confess myself the king of Tyre;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Who, frighted from my country, did wed

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: At Pentapolis the fair Thaisa.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: At sea in childbed died she, but brought forth

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: A maid-child call'd Marina; who, O goddess,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Wears yet thy silver livery. She at Tarsus

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Was nursed with Cleon; who at fourteen years

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: He sought to murder: but her better stars

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Brought her to Mytilene; 'gainst whose shore

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Riding, her fortunes brought the maid aboard us,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Where, by her own most clear remembrance, she

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Made known herself my daughter.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Voice and favour!

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: You are, you are--O royal Pericles!

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Faints

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: What means the nun? she dies! help, gentlemen!

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Noble sir,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: If you have told Diana's altar true,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: This is your wife.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Reverend appearer, no;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I threw her overboard with these very arms.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Upon this coast, I warrant you.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: 'Tis most certain.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Look to the lady; O, she's but o'erjoy'd.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Early in blustering morn this lady was

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Thrown upon this shore. I oped the coffin,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Found there rich jewels; recover'd her, and placed her

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Here in Diana's temple.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: May we see them?

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Great sir, they shall be brought you to my house,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Whither I invite you. Look, Thaisa is recovered.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: O, let me look!

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: If he be none of mine, my sanctity

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Will to my sense bend no licentious ear,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: But curb it, spite of seeing. O, my lord,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Are you not Pericles? Like him you spake,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Like him you are: did you not name a tempest,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: A birth, and death?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The voice of dead Thaisa!

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: That Thaisa am I, supposed dead

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: And drown'd.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Immortal Dian!

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Now I know you better.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: When we with tears parted Pentapolis,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: The king my father gave you such a ring.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Shows a ring

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: This, this: no more, you gods! your present kindness

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Makes my past miseries sports: you shall do well,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: That on the touching of her lips I may

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Melt and no more be seen. O, come, be buried

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: A second time within these arms.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: My heart

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Leaps to be gone into my mother's bosom.

speaker: MARINA
text_entry: Kneels to THAISA

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Look, who kneels here! Flesh of thy flesh, Thaisa;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Thy burden at the sea, and call'd Marina

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: For she was yielded there.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Blest, and mine own!

speaker: HELICANUS
text_entry: Hail, madam, and my queen!

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: I know you not.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: You have heard me say, when I did fly from Tyre,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I left behind an ancient substitute:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Can you remember what I call'd the man?

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: I have named him oft.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: 'Twas Helicanus then.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Still confirmation:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Embrace him, dear Thaisa; this is he.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Now do I long to hear how you were found;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How possibly preserved; and who to thank,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Besides the gods, for this great miracle.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Lord Cerimon, my lord; this man,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Through whom the gods have shown their power; that can

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: From first to last resolve you.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Reverend sir,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: The gods can have no mortal officer

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: More like a god than you. Will you deliver

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: How this dead queen re-lives?

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: I will, my lord.

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Beseech you, first go with me to my house,

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: Where shall be shown you all was found with her;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: How she came placed here in the temple;

speaker: CERIMON
text_entry: No needful thing omitted.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Pure Dian, bless thee for thy vision! I

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Will offer night-oblations to thee. Thaisa,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: This prince, the fair-betrothed of your daughter,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Shall marry her at Pentapolis. And now,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: This ornament

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Makes me look dismal will I clip to form;

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: And what this fourteen years no razor touch'd,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To grace thy marriage-day, I'll beautify.

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: Lord Cerimon hath letters of good credit, sir,

speaker: THAISA
text_entry: My father's dead.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Heavens make a star of him! Yet there, my queen,

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: We'll celebrate their nuptials, and ourselves

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Will in that kingdom spend our following days:

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Our son and daughter shall in Tyrus reign.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Lord Cerimon, we do our longing stay

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: To hear the rest untold: sir, lead's the way.

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: PERICLES
text_entry: Enter GOWER

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: In Antiochus and his daughter you have heard

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Of monstrous lust the due and just reward:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: In Pericles, his queen and daughter, seen,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Although assail'd with fortune fierce and keen,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Virtue preserved from fell destruction's blast,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Led on by heaven, and crown'd with joy at last:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: In Helicanus may you well descry

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: A figure of truth, of faith, of loyalty:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: In reverend Cerimon there well appears

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The worth that learned charity aye wears:

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: For wicked Cleon and his wife, when fame

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Had spread their cursed deed, and honour'd name

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Of Pericles, to rage the city turn,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: That him and his they in his palace burn;

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The gods for murder seemed so content

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: To punish them; although not done, but meant.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: So, on your patience evermore attending,

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: New joy wait on you! Here our play has ending.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Exit
